title: Future Features
body:
Imported from GitLab issue #1: https://gitlab.com/yayatete/knowio/-/issues/1

Author: YAIR TETE @yayatete
Created: 2025-09-21T14:24:08.614Z
Original labels: note

---

Original description:

- Show entities that are also users / in friends list (badges, quick jumps).
- Pull profile photos from Instagram/LinkedIn contacts for entity thumbnails (with user consent).
- What’s New modal since last login (versioned release notes).
- Full text search (Algolia/Meilisearch).
- Graph view (1–2 hops).
- Contacts import, Calendar scan, Instagram OAuth.
- Error reporting (Sentry or similar).

- draft save for entity half created


- circles marketplace - priced sharing
- pull from linked-in--> creates an entity, can be edited and shit (a planning screen with tags selected (creates new ones?)
- pull from a webstite by scraping it/AI


- share with multiple friends at once
- add profile pick for users
- add onboarding after sign-up (name, phone+OTP, some questions, tutorial maybe)

title: overhaul the relations section in the entity page
body:
Imported from GitLab issue #4: https://gitlab.com/yayatete/knowio/-/issues/4

Author: YAIR TETE @yayatete
Created: 2025-09-22T23:06:49.747Z
Original labels: Pending Review, UI, prompt

---

Original description:

there should be a small + icon to add new relation. once clicked it opens the selection field with all available entities, allows search. once picked, closes the picker, and adds the relation.

relations are shown below in medium sized chips. once hovered a small x icon appears at the left side of the chip, clicking it removes the relation. clicking anywhere else on the chip redirects to the related entities page.

title: create interaction flow
body:
Imported from GitLab issue #5: https://gitlab.com/yayatete/knowio/-/issues/5

Author: YAIR TETE @yayatete
Created: 2025-09-22T23:08:57.234Z
Original labels: Pending Review, UI, bug, prompt

---

Original description:

date can only be in the past, disable future dates in the picker, and validate the submission.

type picker is supposed to use dynamic options pulled from an array in the User doc, with creatable option to create new options (updated in the doc), not the placeholder options.

after interaction created- the page should show it with no need for a reload- bug.

interactions section:
- add a + button next to the header, it opens a popup to record an interaction. in the sections itselef.
- seperate interactions with thin lines instead of cards. the date should appear and in the same height, after the date text- al line should continue to cross the page and seperate 
- on the left side, if more than 1 entity was involved in the interaction, show the all the mentioned entities names in chips.

title: what is going on with the is_shared_readonly field?
body:

Created: 2025-09-22T23:30:09.475Z
Original labels: Pending Review, note, prompt

---

Original description:

shared entities should have this field true by default. all shared entities should be read-only. in the future i might introduce write permissions to be granted for certain shared entities, or entities meging with shared ownership, etc.

but right now see that this field is either removed, or defaults to true and make sure that the read-only functionallity is preserved correctly

title: AI review - Architecture Summary
body:
Architecture Summary:
- Client: Next.js (app router), React 19, shadcn/ui components. Firebase client SDK for Auth, Firestore, and Storage.
- Backend: Cloud Firestore (rules-defined authorization), Firebase Storage (scoped upload rules), one Firebase Cloud Function (Firestore trigger).
- Data flows: Client reads/writes Firestore and uploads to Storage directly; function `onShareConfirmed` fans out access by adding `viewer_ids` to `entities`.
- External calls: Firebase (Auth/Firestore/Storage), Vercel Analytics. No AI model usage detected.

Release Blockers:
- package bloat/attack surface: server-only packages included in web client dependencies (shouldn’t ship to browser). Evidence: `package.json:L28-L31`.
- Security headers largely missing (no CSP/HSTS/X-Frame-Options/Referrer-Policy). Evidence: `next.config.ts:L3-L15`.
- No tests or CI; unknown release integrity. Evidence: no `__tests__`, no CI config.
- No privacy policy/ToS/cookie banner; potential legal risk if personal data is processed.
- Backups/restore and incident procedures absent.

Audit Results (table):
Area | Status | Evidence | Risk | Minimal Fix
Security | Needs Work | `package.json:L28-L31`, `next.config.ts:L3-L15` | Larger attack surface; weak browser protections | Remove `firebase-admin`/`firebase-functions` from web deps; add CSP/HSTS/XFO/Referrer headers in `next.config.ts`.
Authn/Authz | Pass | `firebase.rules:L12-L32`, `storage.rules:L4-L12`, `src/components/auth/require-auth.tsx:L12-L19` | Low | Keep rules; add server-side route protection if using SSR.
CSRF/XSS | Needs Work | No CSP; uncontrolled `path` prop for uploads | XSS/unsafe uploads path misuse | Add strict CSP; validate/construct Storage paths on client; server-generate paths if possible.
Injection (NoSQL) | Pass | Firestore security rules enforce owner checks | Low | Keep using param filters + indexes.
SSRF/CORS | Pass | No server HTTP endpoints | Low | N/A.
File upload | Needs Work | `image-uploader.tsx:L12-L16`; `storage.rules:L9-L12` | Mis-path attempts fail, but UX ambiguous | Constrain/derive `path` from `auth.uid` and `entityId`; size/type already enforced.
Secrets | Pass | Uses `NEXT_PUBLIC_*`; no secrets committed | Medium if server secrets added later | Keep secrets in env; add secret scanning.
TLS/Headers | Fail | Only COOP on `/login` | Clickjacking, referrer leaks | Add HSTS, X-Frame-Options DENY, Referrer-Policy same-origin, CSP default-src 'self'.
AI Safety | Pass | No AI usage found | None | If adding AI, add moderation, timeouts, caps.
Data | Needs Work | `firestore.indexes.json`, `firebase.rules` | No backups/retention/encryption docs | Enable automated backups; document retention/GDPR deletion; confirm at-rest encryption (managed by Firebase).
Reliability | Needs Work | No health checks/rollbacks | Cold start minimal; no rollback plan | Add runbooks; use phased deploys; document rollback and restore.
Performance | Needs Work | Web deps include server libs | Larger bundle, slower CWV | Remove server-only deps; analyze bundle; enable caching and pagination everywhere.
Observability | Needs Work | Only Vercel Analytics present | Hard to debug prod issues | Add structured logging and error reporting (Sentry) with user/session IDs.
Testing | Fail | No tests present | Regressions undetected | Add minimal unit tests for hooks and integration tests for Firestore rules.
Build & Release | Needs Work | Lockfile present; no CI | Inconsistent builds | Add CI with lint/tsc/build/test; npm audit; SBOM.
Accessibility & UX | Needs Work | No a11y checks in repo | Potential WCAG issues | Run Lighthouse; fix contrast, focus, labels.
Compliance & Legal | Fail | No policy docs | Legal exposure | Add Privacy Policy, ToS, cookie banner if applicable.
Cost & Quotas | Needs Work | No rate limits/quotas | Cost spikes | Add Firestore/Storage usage alerts; client rate limiting/backoff.

Runbooks:
- Incident (P0/P1): Identify blast radius; disable affected feature (feature flag); contact on-call; postmortem within 24h.
- On-call checklist: Check error dashboard; validate Firestore/Storage status; roll back last deploy if correlated; notify stakeholders.
- Rollback steps: Revert to previous deployment in hosting; redeploy functions previous version; clear CDN.
- Backup/restore drill: Enable daily Firestore exports; document restore to temp project; verify data integrity; cut over.
- Access escalation: Break-glass Firebase IAM group; time-bound elevation; audit log review after.

SLO Fit:
- Target availability: 99.9% (Firebase managed). Assumption; verify with hosting provider.
- Target latency p95: <300 ms for cached reads; <600 ms for Firestore writes. Measure via RUM and server timings.
- Error rate: <1% 5xx/Firestore denied. Add alerts at 0.5% over 5 min.

Cost Snapshot:
- Est. $/1k reads: ~$0.06 Firestore; writes ~$0.18; Storage egress varies. No AI costs.
- 30-day forecast at {expected_rps}: Monthly reads ≈ 2.6M × {expected_rps}; cost ≈ $156 × {expected_rps} (reads only). Add writes/egress. Verify in Firebase Usage dashboards.

Verdict: No-Go

Top 5 Next Actions:
1) Remove server-only deps from web and analyze bundle (reduce page weight). Edit `package.json` to remove `firebase-admin` and `firebase-functions`; reinstall.
2) Add security headers (CSP, HSTS, X-Frame-Options, Referrer-Policy) in `next.config.ts`; test with Observatory.
3) Set Storage path derivation client-side from `auth.uid` and `entityId`; validate before upload; keep size/type limits.
4) Add minimal CI with lint/tsc/build/test and npm audit; add 5–10 unit/integration tests; add Sentry.
5) Publish Privacy Policy/ToS and enable Firestore automated backups; write rollback/restore runbooks.

Evidence (file/lines):
- `package.json:L28-L31` (server-only deps in web)
- `next.config.ts:L3-L15` (missing headers)
- `src/lib/firebase.ts:L10-L21` (browser-only init, env usage)
- `src/components/entity/image-uploader.tsx:L12-L16` (upload path from prop)
- `firebase.rules:L12-L32,L60-L74` (owner-based access)
- `storage.rules:L4-L12` (scoped path + size/type)
- `functions/src/index.ts:L11-L25` (share fanout trigger)
- `firestore.indexes.json:L4-L18,L36-L50` (indexes present)
